summary: Benzene (C6H6) is a natural hydrocarbon found in petroleum. It has six carbon atoms arranged in a hexagon with hydrogen atoms attached. Benzene is a clear, flammable liquid with a sweet smell, often found in gasoline. It's used to make other chemicals, like ethylbenzene, but is toxic and can cause health problems, including cancer. Recently, benzene contamination in Boston has been linked to potential leukemia cases.
title: Benzene
